itemDesc: Payload for light artillery weapons.
Payload for heavy artillery weapons.
Standard ammunition for anti-tank rifles.
vehiclePen: Damage to the sides and rear of armored vehicles have a higher chance to penetrate at close range and at direct angles.

itemDesc: A shell that is launched over short distances by a spigot mortar.
Payload for the storm cannon.
Standard explosive shell for small vehicles or infantry weapons.
vehiclePen: Damage to the sides and rear of armored vehicles have a higher chance to penetrate at close range and at direct angles.

itemDesc: The 3C-High Explosive Rocket (also known as HE Rockets) is a large artillery rocket.
Standard payload for light tanks.
vehiclePen: Damage to the sides and rear of armored vehicles have a higher chance to penetrate at close range and at direct angles.

itemDesc: The 4C-Fire Rocket (also known as Fire Rockets) is a large artillery rocket.
An anti-tank shell that's effective against penetrating tank armor.
vehiclePen: Damage to the sides and rear of armored vehicles have a higher chance to penetrate at close range and at direct angles.
vehiclePenChance: High chance to penetrate armored vehicles.

itemDesc: 94.5mm is a large anti-tank Shell used by large cannons and very useful against armored vehicles.
An anti-tank projectile fired from an R.P.G.
vehiclePen: Damage to the sides and rear of armored vehicles have a higher chance to penetrate at close range and at direct angles.
vehiclePenChance: High chance to penetrate armored vehicles.

itemDesc: An anti-tank projectile fired from indirect R.P.G. weapons.
vehiclePen: High chance to penetrate armored vehicles.

itemDesc: An adherable grenade designed to penetrate heavy tank armor. The sticky bomb can only be thrown a short distance and is ineffective against structures.
damageDesc: High chance of disabling Track subsystem

itemDesc: A compact anti-tank grenade that can be fired from rifle grenade launcher attachments or grenade turrets. Its dense payload excels at crippling armoured vehicles while being versatile and easy to transport.

A variant of the Booker Storm Rifle, the Greyhound boasts a larger overall receiver and barrel to accommodate the increased stopping power of anti-tank rounds. Its longer, bulkier barrel allows for increased range. As a heavier automatic rifle,.
This heavy infantry cannon requires a tripod for stability. The Daucus is designed to give infantry a foothold against enemy vehicles and light fortifications or established fortified garrisons.

A three-round burst anti-tank rifle with a high-capacity magazine. Built from a modified “Dusk” assault rifle, the receiver has been altered to support top-loaded twin-drum magazines for better stability and efficient loading to account for its more cumbersome design and higher calibre rounds.
Green ash is an asphyxiating toxin. Inhaling it without protection will result in a quick death. Be sure to wear a gas mask with fresh filters when handling green ash.
An incendiary payload used with mortar tubes. Will ignite objects near impact..
This densely packed, high-explosive grenade is designed to damage structures and vehicles.

The Model-7 “Evie” is a Colonial Depth Charge, which is a Large Item Explosive Charge that is primarily used against underwater naval vehicles, such as Submarines. In order to be launched, it must be primed to explode at a certain depth.

The “Molten Wind” v.II Flame Torch is a Colonial handheld Flamethrower. Due to its incendiary damage and AoE, it's best used against Structures and swarms of infantry. It can damage unarmored vehicles but not armored ones.
The Moray Torpedo is a Warden high explosive shell. It is a Large Item that is primarily used against naval vehicles.
A shell that ignites midair and illuminates a large area, revealing enemy targets.
An explosive projectile fired from a mortar.
A shell that explodes into shrapnel on impact, devastating nearby infantry.
A deadly, long-range sniper rifle with exceptional stopping power. The “Quickhatch” is a gluttonous firearm that hungers for enemy armour and flesh alike.
An explosive projectile fired from an R.P.G.
vehiclePen: Damage to the sides and rear of armored vehicles have a higher chance to penetrate at close range and at direct angles.

itemDesc: The payload for ballistic rockets. A high yield bomb that delivers over 3 tons of TNT and is capable of leveling an entire village or town block.
